Reviews.Content: Hated it! WOW! Where do I start? I stayed in the Residence Inn and find the staff and their attitudes toward their guests to be reprehensible. There is a lady named Tonya at the front desk who should stay home on most days because she appears to be very unhappy with herself and only smiles when the General Manager is on site. One of the older female workers in the cafeteria started a verbal argument with my 13 yr. old in front of many guest because she asked for milk 5 minutes after breakfast was over. I was confronted by the so-called Front Desk Manager, Big Martha ( former housekeeping manager lol!) about a charge I had previously paid. Apparently my payment had not been properly documented. Sounds like theft to me. Thank God for receipts. The workers all appear to be busy when everyone knows their motive is to go outside for a cigarette break and to talk about upper management all during the day. I know because they have voiced their complaints with me while I was having a cigarette break. LOL. On more than one occasion my room has been entered into without so much as a knock. My phone calls were blocked for no apparent reason. The front desk is often abandoned during their so-called social hour and breakfast so the employees may gorge themselves in that slop they call food. I witnessed the handyman picking up the POOP bags out of the waste basket and head directly to the food bar and helped himself. Don't even ask me if he washed his hands. On another occasion I happened to be checking on my little girls to find two grown engineers that worked for the hotel doing a TELEPHONE WIRE repair. Security is so laxed that people who aren't even guest show up for happy hour and breakfast. Not to mention I was informed of a death in room 304 by one of the hotel employees. A man fell to his death outside of my hotel room while painting a piece of this God forbidden hotel. He was on a tall ladder with no harness. To top things off I was charged a $250 room restoration fee for a smoke smell in the room when this smell existed LONG before I got there. God knows how many people have paid this fee for that same room time and time again. I am forwarding this as a formal complaint to their corporate offices , as well as, listing on every review database imaginable because I gave them fair warning after the first couple of incidents. I no longer take my complaints up with management because they seem to perpetuate this bad culture.
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsNewOrleans

Reviews.Content: No,No,No Never Stay Here This hotel is a dump. I don't know were to start. This hotel has outside access to rooms, no security. Even though the room was non smoking, I could hardly breathe. It smelled so bad. The bathroom was so moldy and the chairs were covered in stains. I had a room with a full kitchen and was scared to open the cabinets. I could not wait to get out of there. Also if you arrive after 5 you will not have a parking spot and they have no help finding one.
Reviews.Author: OreoMidnight

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay If you are looking for a quiet, spacious, and clean hotel; this is it. Great place to stay all the way around. Great ammenities and helpful staff. The location is a long walk from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter District; but there are plenty of cabs at all hours. This is also a pet friendly hotel.
Reviews.Author: Idam71

Reviews.Content: Depends On Your Needs I picked this hotel because it came with a full kitchen and two separate bedrooms with a rollout couch in the suite/kitchen area. I was traveling with two teen daughters and my wife and I felt this would give us the space we needed. We didn鈥檛 want to have to go out to eat ever time we got hungry. I also was attending a play in town at the Convention Center and this hotel was supposed to be conveniently located by the Convention Center. That ended up being a long unsafe walk also. The rooms were large the beds were too small. Both rooms came with doubles in them. While the suite was clean the furnishings were well below the standard of other Residence Inns I have stayed. If you are hanging out in the Quarter you do not want to stay here unless you are catching cabs. It is too far and too unsafe to walk from this hotel. I found myself driving even to the Casino and parking there. I was told by a desk clerk I could park on the street Friday thru Sunday free. I received a $40.00 ticket on Saturday morning. Given the correct circumstances I would stay at this hotel again. With planning it can be accomplished. I would however under no circumstances stay at this hotel if I were not traveling with children. Not even for a good rate.Richard - Houston
Reviews.Author: Chop281Shop

Reviews.Content: Tired, dingy, and needs updating This was the first time I've stayed at a Residence Inn in several years. The ones I stayed in before were nicer than a regular hotel room. This property was not as nice as a regular hotel.The place was clean and the staff were nice.The room I stayed in hadn't been updated since the place was built in the 1980's. The location of the hotel is not convenient unless you're going to the convention center. It is in the warehouse district surrounding by some occupied and abandoned warehouses. It didn't seem safe after dark.Luckily I used a reward night and didn't have to pay for the hotel. I stay in New Orleans regularly for business. I would not recommend this hotel for someone looking for a good tourist experience.It would probably be okay for folks staying in New Orleans and working on the rebuilding efforts since each suite has a kitchen and there's a laundry room.
Reviews.Author: Daisy38

Reviews.Content: Mediocre Experience This was my first time to New Orleans. I stayed here with colleagues of mine on a business trip. It's a short walk from the convention center which was convenient. They also had a good breakfast in the mornings. These are probably the 2 best things about this hotel.The room was just okay. It was big and decently clean. However the lobby/check in area leaves a lot to be desired. It's not the most inviting or welcoming area and a little bit sketchy with surveillance cameras, etc. I have stayed in Residence Inns before but they were always nicer than this one. There were no problems per say but given a choice I would probably not stay here again.
Reviews.Author: akd07

Reviews.Content: Cannot Believe It's a Marriott This hotel NEEDS A RENOVATION BADLY. Didn't realize that hurricane Katrina hit the hotel too (and nothing around it). We stayed in a 2bd rm/ 2bth suite from 11/28-12/1/07. The room was very worn. The only saving grace for the room was the comfortable beds.Staff was great. Very helpful and polite.Breakfast was not very good comparing to the Marriott Residence Inn in Adventura, Fla (just north of Miami).Location was very good. 2 blocks from the convention center.Overall, 2 thumbs down for this location. Not up to par with other Marriott facilities.
Reviews.Author: tn0265

Reviews.Content: tired We've stayed at Residence Inns before and were expecting better at this New Orleans location. It was built (or actually transformed from a warehouse) about 10 years ago and it needs a facelift. Maybe it's a victim of low-price contracts with recovery personnel since Katrina, because service was minimal. Our suite didn't get cleaned until afternoon each day. The carpet was worn, the hardware on the bathtub falling off. Complimentary breakfast was generous but inadequately staffed. They would run out of food and take much too long to re-stock. Newspapers were in short supply, and tables weren't bused often enough. The afternoon happy hour was a joke. Only available weekdays (I think the same is true of breakfast), it lasts only an hour or so and consisted of cheap, awful wine and stale beer in pitchers and a single, cheap dish such as lasagna each evening. There was nowhere else in the block or across the street to eat or get a drink, though the warehouse/museum district is full of hotels and restaurants. Worst problem: parking, which was across a dark, narrow side street. There was one street light, no exterior lighting on the side of the hotel, no valet parking, no convenient handicap parking.
Reviews.Author: CCTramp

Reviews.Content: OK The building the hotel is in is pretty cool -- it's a converted warehouse. Catwalks lead between the upper rooms. But the coolness ends there. The rooms are typical (but very worn) Residence Inn. They're huge, which is great. The water pressure would disappear in the morning and the water would just stop running. That wasn't so great. The breakfast consists of dyhydrated scrambled eggs and microwaved sausage. The food at happy hour is basically the same instantly prepared stuff. Could be a good value for the right price. On-street parking was relatively easy to find after 5pm or so, and it's free until 8am and on Sundays.
Reviews.Author: JimmyEv

Reviews.Content: Great stay I stayed at the Residence Inn in June this year for a conference at the Convention Center. The hotel was exactly what you expect from a Residence Inn...clean, well organized, great breakfast and nice people. There are several good places to eat nearby, the convention center is 3 blocks away and even the Quarter is 7-10 blocks (don't try this walk on a hot day!). The people at the hotel were very nice..I left clothes in the closet when I checked out, called them and they send them via FEDEX the next day.Great place to stay.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good location - Getting run down and poor room service The location (Warehouse District) is perfect since you are a 5 minute walk to downtown, 10 minutes to French Quarter and 10 minutes to Garden District. If you don't want to walk you are 2 blocks from the Streetcars for both locations. The hotel is run down and definately has a smell, as another writer has said. The courtyard has a pool which is looking a little murky and a basketball court. It's usually full of kids, which is great if you have kids. The breakfast is fine, but nothing to write home about, it's a typical buffet breakfast, but nice that it's free. I prefer not to eat it. The cleaniness is the biggest issue. Our bathroom wasn't clean, the maid forgets to replace things. We are here at a really good price $75, so it's one of those you get what you pay for. Front desk staff is pleasant. If I was looking for romance and charm, it wouldn't be here, maybe the Monaco or a suite hotel on a quiet street in the French Quarter.
Reviews.Author: vancouver_realtor

Reviews.Content: great place We came to New Orleans for a conference at the convention center. We didn't book our rooms right away so I was leary of what this hotel would be like. We were pleasantly suprised. Our flight was late getting in so by the time we got to the hotel, it was after midnight. The man checking us in was very friendly and upgraded our room to a suite. It was huge! The complimentary breakfast in the morning is great. The hotel is in a great location between the convention center, Bourbon Street and Harrah's. We will definitely stay here again. Oh yes, the room rates were awesome!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay here again Stayed here from 11-16 Jul for the Cisco Networkers convention. The first thing we noticed was the moldy smell of the room, which stayed unless the AC was running extremely cold. We found black mold on the soap dish and were told by the maid it couldn't be cleaned because they weren't allowed to use bleach. Later maintenance came up to caulk over the offending mold. (Yeah that helped) The rooms were big enough for three, although, in the one bedroom suite, the bathroom was inside the bedroom, so those using the sleeper sofa had to go through the bedroom to the bathroom. SO much for privacy. They did have a nice breakfast each morning, and it was a challenge to keep everything up, but they managed. I liked the Belgian waffles. The evenings manager reception had warm beer and wine, and cold food. On hotdog and hamburger night they ran out of hotdogs in the first 10 minutes. My wife had mold growing on her hamburger bun. When she brought it to the attention of the staff, they thanked her and threw the offending bun away, but didn't check the other buns in the basket to see if anymore were moldy ( I guess that was our job). Most days housekeeping came by, one day they came by at 9:00 a.m. to et the towels and bedding, and came back at 4:30P.M. to see if wanted our room cleaned. Three out of five days they didn鈥檛 refill our coffee basket, twice we had to ask for toilet paper. We used valet parking, were told 鈥淛ust call down with your ticket number and the car will be brought around鈥? Every time, we had to ask again when we got to the desk because 鈥淣obody鈥?told the valet. The beds were decent, the bathroom was okay (if moldy), and the rooms were large. But, if I have to go to New Orleans again, I will not stay in this hotel.
Reviews.Author: chipster45

Reviews.Content: Awesome Place to stay The hotel was amazing! The rooms were spacious, with everything you need to live with. They gave you free breakfast every morning (buffet style), and the pool was clean. It was close to all the sites.The only bad thing was one day the made did not come, but otherwise, the room and service was outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Trish11679

Reviews.Content: love this hotel stayed there for my anniversary in July.Was wonderful hotel really nice staff,big nice rooms,and good location.This is where I will stay when I go to New Orleans.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice! This place is nice - a restored warehouse that is square shaped with a beautiful courtyard in the middle with pool, hot tub, tables, chairs, and even a basketball halfcourt. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the continental breakfast and evening happy hour were above average. 4 blocks from Conv. Center, a good 3/4 mile from Bourbon. Good show, mate!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Super for Jazzfest Been a couple months but since there weren't any other reviews I'm writing one. Location's a leisurely 10 minute walk from the French Quarter. Got a great price on Hotwire though and was very happy. Security seemed to work, everyone enters past the front desk and everything's bottoned up real tight. An older buidling redone, not fancy but clean and quiet. Quiet's rare over inthe French Quarter. THe pool was nice. The staff was very nice. The kitchen was useful. The seperate bedroom would make sharing very doable for adults and would be good for families too. Apparently some rooms are studios. Free breakfast was pretty typically boring but the sausage gravy has a New Orleans Zing to it with lots of sage--delicious.
Reviews.Author: TexasYokel
